[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Open Spending Platform (OSP) defines requirements for managing datasets, APIs, and visualizations for fiscal transparency.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: OSP supports dataset publication, analysis, visualization, and API interactions.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: OSP integrates with Python clients, GitHub, and fiscal APIs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: OSP provides web dashboards for dataset publishing and visualization.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: OSP operates on scalable cloud infrastructure.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: OSP links to mapping and fiscal analysis tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: OSP optimizes storage and retrieval of large datasets.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: OSP ensures continuous uptime with scheduled maintenance.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: OSP supports multilingual data and adaptive schemas.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: OSP connects to fiscal tools and visualization platforms.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: OSP facilitates dataset publishing, metadata validation, API access, and visualization.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: OSP serves publishers, analysts, agencies, and the public.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: OSP relies on network connectivity and structured data formats.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: OSP adheres to open data policies and fiscal standards.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Dataset: A structured collection of data.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with GitHub for dataset version control.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide RESTful APIs for data retrieval and filtering.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall support fiscal visualization platform integration.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow authorized users to edit, hide, and delete datasets (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall enforce metadata validation and schema compliance (REQ-DSGN-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall allow API users to normalize data using GDP and population statistics.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive interface for dataset publishing and visualization.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process visualization requests within 3 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support 2,000 concurrent users.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store dataset metadata, version history, and configurations.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall track dataset modifications and access logs.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with fiscal data visualization standards.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall encrypt stored and transmitted data.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to ISO and open data standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall enforce role-based access control (RBAC).
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall maintain 99.9% uptime and secure API transactions.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests dataset edits, metadata validation, visualizations, and API functions.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Metadata standards, API reference guides, and architecture diagrams.
[SEC] 5. References: ISO standards, fiscal visualization guidelines, and GitHub API documentation.
